questions.question_text: Which statement about LLDP is true?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
It is configured in global configuration mode.

choices.A: It is a Cisco proprietary protocol.
choices.B: It is configured in global configuration mode.
choices.D: It runs over the transport layer.
choices.C: The LLDP update frequency is a fixed value.

questions.question_text: What are two benefits of private IPv4 IP addresses? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
B. They are less costly than public IP addresses.
C. They can be assigned to devices without Internet connections

choices.B: They are less costly than public IP addresses.
choices.A: They are routed to the Internet the same as public IP addresses.
choices.C: They can be assigned to devices without Internet connections.
choices.D: They eliminate the necessity for NAT policies.

questions.question_text: When is the most appropriate time to escalate an issue that you troubleshooting?

choices.C: When you have gathered all information about an issue
choices.B: When a more urgent issue that requires your intervention is detected
choices.A: When you lack the proper to resolve the issue.
choices.D: When you have been unable to resolve the issue after 30 min

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
because it has the lowest MAC address.
C because it has the lowest MAC address.

comments.content: In this question, the lowest MAC Address is considered

STP chooses root bridge between all switches involved in STP. The root bridge is the one with the lower priority; if more switches have the same priority the root switch is the one with lower MAC-Address.

questions.question_text: If the primary root bridge experiences a power loss, which switch takes over?
